  for being on The Path.
quote: "If you really look closely, most overnight successes took a long time." Steve Jobs

step_of_the_day.title:
Establishing The Path for success. The Path can help you avoid getting overwhelmed or discouraged as your
  work toward success (Pillar #9)
step_of_the_day.content:
We are a society of comparers. We are always comparing ourselves to someone who has more or has done more,
  or looks better, looks thinner or younger. We are more inclined to notice what we haven't done over what we
  have done; what's wrong rather than what' right about ourselves. This approach adds to stress and hurts
  self-confidence and sense of self. And it can cause us to procrastinate or interrupt progress toward our
  goals.It's helpful to focus more on what we have done, and to appreciate the steps that we take. How do you avoid
  feeling bad about what still needs to be done? This was my intention in developing the concept of "The
  Path". Rather than focusing on the ultimate goal, or giving in to nervousness about what still needs to be
  done, The Path, allows you to feel good as long as you are working toward your goals as well as good health
  - the 9 pillars. If you identify the steps that you need to be taking, and then take those steps, this puts
  you on The Path. Once on The Path you can rest easy, knowing that you are on The Path to success.

action_step:
Today, identify one or two steps you can take toward your goals. When you take them, remind yourself that
  you are on The Path. Then relax.
journal_entry:
Write about your efforts during these "365 Steps on The Path to Resilience and Success" to feel good about
  your progress, and about yourself.
